poem:
Title: "In Prone Silence"

In pacific California,
three officers, Hands bound by
invisible law—charged.

Five minutes,
the life gauge of a young man
held in cold blue hands.

Names bloom,
Gonzalez—weighty as an orchard,
Price—sharp as a robin's call,
McKinley, Fisher, Leahy—cutting,
like a winter frost.

In their wake, 
red sirens,
the pulse of a City stilled,
A justice like hard pit of the cherry,
yet to break.
